TopicTitle: Sketchfab - Science Bay and Duna Mission

Articles.Content:
I was not aware of Sketchfab until today. What an awesome FREE tool. Below are two of my creations. You can get inside the serviced bays and see the instruments. Once you get in, switch to 1st person view to look around. Note, struts and procedural parts will likely not show or show correctly.

The [original thread](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/123480-Proper-3D-screenshots-where-you-can-rotate-crafts-now-available!) that I stumbled upon is linked.

Here is [Sketchfab.](https://sketchfab.com/)

They have a chain letter expansion like scheme that will give you more controls on the settings such as brightness. I shamelessly present my https://skfb.ly/FvQE

join link for your consideration.

<iframe width="640" height="480" frameborder="0" allowfullscreen=""></iframe>

[Duna Lander Open](https://sketchfab.com/models/c0a139d53f854b89b2cdf115d402e54a) by [Montag](https://sketchfab.com/montag) on [Sketchfab](https://sketchfab.com)

<iframe width="640" height="480" frameborder="0" allowfullscreen=""></iframe>

[Science Bay](https://sketchfab.com/models/687c6331031e47d7927c83188c5312bd) by [Montag](https://sketchfab.com/montag) on [Sketchfab](https://sketchfab.com)

I wanted ladders in the bay for the Kerbal to grab so you can get multiple gravity readings easier.
